fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When creating a "Create from Template" macro in a page and select right-aligned in the page. The position of the button placed randomly after published. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a "Create from Template" button and select right-align
**  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  
 # Try to Save it/Publish it
 # Notice that the button has moved to the left side of the page
**  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!   


h3. *Expected Results*

The button should be always consistently sticking to the position defined.

h3. *Actual Results*

The button ignoring the defined position after published.

h3. *Notes*

Note that the button doesn't always stick to the left once published as sometime it will stick to the top.


h3. *Workaround*
 # Placing the cursor at the beginning of the macro before choosing the format.
**  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create from Templates macro ignoring formatting position when published

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In my instance, I want to fetch all pages in the ALPHA space. These pages are named "Page x" where x is a number from 0 - 99.

I make a request to [Get content children by type|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-child-type-get] using the content ID of the homepage which returns pages 0 - 24 successfully.

I follow the "next" link in that response payload to get the next set of 25 results, however, the response contains pages 4-9 again and then pages 30-48

Each "next" link always returns some of the pages from the first request, so there are some pages I never retrieve from the REST API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 50 pages (or child pages); the test was done by creating 50 pages with titles "Page 0" to "Page 49" 
# Call [Get content children by type|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-child-type-get] and use the parent page (or the page ID of the homepage) with limit 25
# Call the same endpoint and add the {{start}} query parameter with the value of 25

h3. Expected Results
A new set of results unique from the previous calls.

h3. Actual Results
Pages 4 to 9 are repeated on the 1st and 2nd call
fields.summary: Get content children by type REST API returns duplicate pages on pagination

fields.description: I noticed on https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/webhook/ it suggested that it fires webhooks for "login", "login_failed" and "logout". These webhooks do not exist in the cloud version of Atlassian Connect. They should be removed from the documentation as these webhooks don't make sense for a Confluence site as a user logins in and out at a global level and this is not a concern of content.
fields.summary: "login", "login_failed" and "logout" webhooks should be removed from the documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the [Jira macros for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-issues-macro-139380.html], the user has a button to *Hide Summary* in order to only show the key and the status of the issue. However, the same is not always working. While it works on the *Preview* mode, after having the page published, the modification for the macro will not be applied.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page in Confluence
# Click on *Insert > Jira* in order to insert a Jira macro and select an existing issue from your Jira application.
# *Insert* the issue to the page and click on *edit* for the issue that will be on the page. Then, hit the *Hide Summary* button.
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The summary of the macro would be hidden. 

h3. Actual Results

The summary will keep intact and only apply the changes sometimes. 
 
h3. Notes
* Note that this is a sporadic behavior, similar to [CONFCLOUD-58091|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58091].
* The Preview will always identify the modification.
*  It works often when first publishing/creating the page and displaying/hiding the summary for the macro. 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: "Hide Summary" Button Works Intermittently for Jira Macros

fields.summary: Site import fails while clearing data (EntityNotFoundException)

fields.description:
We are sometimes exporting content from other spaces when performing a space export in confluence server (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-62131 ). I believe this is one part of what caused [https://hello.atlassian.net/browse/ADM-180349] during the EAC -> Hello migration.

We should be filtering out page templates that don't belong to the space being imported, but instead we seem to be including them and erroneously considering them to be global page templates.

Also, if we actually do encounter any legitimate global page templates during a space import, we should still not import them.

Space exports from EAC that I know contain content from other spaces:
 * "I": also contains "ECloud"
 * "ECO": also contains "DA"
 * "INFRA": also contains "ECloud"
 * "QE": also contains "JCC"
fields.summary: We are importing page templates from other spaces as global instead of excluding them

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Table of Contents macro display a first blank entry if it's placed at the top of the page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with different Headings
# Insert a Table of Contents (TOC) macro at the top of the page.

h3. Expected Results
The macro should display the entries for each of the headings and nothing more.

h3. Actual Results
It shows a blank entry at the top:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-08 at 19.36.59.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround
Create a layout on the page and move the macro to another section.
fields.summary: Table of contents macro display empty first entry

fields.description:
This would be used for events & conferences. Scheduling blocks for setup, registration hours, discussion panels & sessions, lunch/breaks, shifts, etc...  Swimlanes for different crews, etc..

(optionally including a possible "working hours only" toggle & input variables for multi-day conference planning)


The Roadmap Planner is really cool. I would like to be able to use it to help visually plan our annual systems showcase event.

 

Related Issues:
 * CONFCLOUD-36095 (Weeks) <-- done
 * CONFCLOUD-40412 (Days)
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro: 'Hours' granularity

fields.description: Provide the administrative ability to prevent the full page content to be included in e-mail notifications globally for the entire Confluence site. And provide the ability to choose between HTML and Plain Text for the format of email notifications.
fields.summary: Disable full content e-mail notifications

It is good to add "My recent update" link,   currently only have "my recent view", "my recent work", but my recent work just navigate to a page with multiple tabs, none of the tab showing page I recently changed.

fields.description:
Public (anonymous) users can't view public wiki pages from a browser on a mobile device unless they request desktop view. If they request mobile view it asks them to sign in using their Atlassian ID.

h3. Expected behavior
Anonymous access should allow pages to be accessed via mobile view

h3. Actual behavior
If they request mobile view it asks them to sign in using their Atlassian ID.
fields.summary: Anonymous users can't currently access public wiki pages using mobile view
Freeze while upgrading styled-components from 1.4.6 to v3.3.3

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It's currently not possible to access any page using Anonymous user accessing on the Mobile Browser.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Mobile Browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the mobile browser using an Anonymous session (Incognito)
 # Try to access any public page

h3. Expected Results

The page should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

The login screen is shown, forcing Anonymous users to login, even if the page is public.
h3. Notes

The page is accessible using the desktop browser.
h3. Workaround

Use the *Desktop site* option on the mobile browser.
fields.summary: Can't use Confluence Mobile (browser) as Anonymous

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
When accessing Space Settings, the following error message is displayed:
{code}
===
A system error has occurred - our apologies!

For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base for a solution.

If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system with the following information:

a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
a copy of the error and system information found below
a copy of the application logs (if possible).

Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage…

====
{code}
fields.summary: Space Settings not accessible

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
When trying to import a Word file in Confluence, the same is not possible when there is a header within the file which is colored. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Word file
# Insert some random text, and a colored header as well
#* It can be copied from One Note as well, since it imports the formatting of the headers (colored)
# Import a Word file to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
A page would be created based on the content of the Word File

h3. Actual Results
There are no errors that mention the color of the header, but the import will fail with a generic "Import Failed" error. 

h3. Workaround
Remove the formatting of the header, and import again.
fields.summary: Importing docx with colored header does not work

fields.description:
Currently, The Atlassian Companion only registers the first save operation in a desktop application, after which the file remains open and editable. Further saves are not registered, which can leave to data loss in cases where users are unaware of this flow.

The Companion user experience would benefit greatly from allowing multiple saves or providing a way for the user to signal when the changes are complete and an upload can be made.
fields.summary: Improve Atlassian Companion to allow multiple saves

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Office Powerpoint macro shows all slides on the page, in order, which can be unfriendly for some users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show only a single slide at a time, and display next and previous arrows on the screen.


h3. Workaround
Use the presentation mode.
fields.summary: Show controls on the Office Powerpoint macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When selected German as the default language in the browser, the languages in collapse/expand macro toggle between english/german.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page with collapse/expand macro
# Set German as the default language
# Allow "auto detect language" in Confluence settings
# Navigate to the page and found out the option was display in German/English

h3. Expected Results
Collapse/expand macro option display fully in German


h3. Actual Results
The menu toggle between English and German

h3.Workaround
select German as the default profile language
fields.summary: Inconsistency language used in collapsing/expanding source macro

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Clicking on the link to a task from the task report page does not open the expand macro to reveal the selected task on the destination page.

This issue is affecting both the current editor, as well as the new fabric editor that is rolling out.
h2. How to reproduce
 # Create a Task report

 * Click create.
 * Select Task report

 # Create a blank page
 # Add the expand macro to the blank page
 # Provide a task within the expand macro

h3. Expected behaviour

The page with the task will be opened and the macro with the task inside will be expanded. 
 !Screenshot_79.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual results

The page with the task is opened but the macro with the task inside is collapsed. 
 !Screenshot_78.png|thumbnail!
h2. Workaround

Click on the expand macro to reveal the task
fields.summary: Clicking on Task within expand macro fails to expand the macro to reveal the task
CSS are not aplied on PDF export when using Calibri custom font

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with the following settings:
** Atlassian account display name: double-byte texts(ex: 山田太郎)
** Confluence username: double-byte texts including double-byte space(ex: 山田　太郎)
# Navigate to a page, click the key icon, select "Viewing and editing restricted" and type the username in the textbox

h3. Expected Results
User can add 山田太郎

h3. Actual Results
The suggestion box keeps loading and it is unable to add 山田太郎
 
h3.Workaround
Access https://id.atlassian.com and change the display name to single-byte texts.
(Currently there are no ways to update the Confluence username on the user-side).

h3. Note
* Currently, Confluence username can be found in the URL  of the user details page in the site admin menu(https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/users/view?username=<username>).
If the username contains douyble-byte space, the following texts will be included in the URL above.
{code}
%E3%80%80
{code}

Aug 23 2018
This issue is happening with usernames which have double-byte texts with single-byte space(ex. 山田 太郎), too.
fields.summary: Unable to add double-byte usernames to restricted pages

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Allow anonymous access to a Confluence site
 # Create a space and restrict it so that anonymous users don't have access
 # When viewing the space (e.g. its overview page), you just see a blank screen with no helpful error messages

!image-2018-08-03-17-22-43-825.png|thumbnail!

It may be rare for an anonymous user to hit this scenario (they would need to click on an existing link from somewhere).
fields.summary: Anonymous users see a blank page instead of an error when viewing a space they don't have access to

fields.description:
h3. Summary
At the first time a global template is being edited, it's not possible to add labels.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the global templates admin page (/wiki/pages/templates2/listpagetemplates.action)
# Edit any template (that hasn't been edited before);

h3. Expected Results
* The *Label* icon should be shown along with the template's title.

h3. Actual Results
* No *Label* icon is shown.

h3.Workaround
Save the template (even if no change was made) and edit it again. The icon will be shown.
fields.summary: Not possible to add labels to a template in the first edit

h2. Workaround

Contact support so we can check the logs for details on which user has the conflict, then we would need to open the entities.xml file and change the username of the conflicting user to match the username from the target instance.

The impact of this bug has been mostly fixed, the only remaining case is for cloud-to-cloud space import where at least one user is a member of both sites, and has a different username for each site. That will be tracked here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-63263

fields.description:
This is a post about the Atlassian Community. Maybe that is Confluence, i'm not sure.

 

When I go to a page such as [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-filter-notifications-using-JIRA-Cloud-Slack-integration/qaq-p/679918] I see:

 
 * five posts by five users… 
 * SIX copies of my own avatar next to a 'reply/type your answer box' including the 'suggest an answer button'.

When just browsing the questions, since I'm logged in, it looks like I've already replied a bunch of times.

I see you are trying to encourage commenting (sort of like "Your name here!")  but this is too much.

 

Suggestion:
 * don't show my avatar as if I have replied six times to this page
 * show my avatar only if I actually click in one of the reply boxes

 

Example: https://www.dropbox.com/s/zhbamtxllni3xma/excessive-avatars.png?dl=0
fields.summary: COMMUNITY: excessive use of avatars
appSwitcherDropdown closed is not fired

fields.description: Would you add a viewing/editing mode where all unresolved comments are always visible, a-la Google Docs? It is nice to see all related issues in a glance, especially when multiple people are working on the same page. In some workflows, easy discoverability of open comments is important. In my company, this holding up wide adoption of Confluence - people prefer GDoc commenting.
fields.summary: Collaboration mode for viewing/editing a page

h3. Summary
When you export a space/site to XML, Audit log entries of the export will show an Atlassian IP address 104.192.139.229 instead of the user who performs the export. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a space or site to XML
# Check Audit log entries

h3. Expected Results
* Audit log entries of space/site export should show the IP address of the person who performs the export. 

h3. Actual Results
* Audit log entries of space/site export is showing an Atlassian IP address 104.192.139.229

fields.description:
As mention in Security Practices documentation available here:

https://www.atlassian.com/trust/security/security-practices#faq-5fd9f2cf-d7c7-40fa-af1f-854e2d9f3f48

\"Content stored within Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud isn't encrypted. However, attachments on storage in AWS are encrypted. We believe we can rely on the physical controls and management at AWS, as well as transit-level encryption to protect customer data. A minimum of 128-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is used for attachments.\"

As per our customer requirements, one of their controls requires that they encrypt all customer data while at rest. Should we consider Confluence content to be encrypted at rest (not just the attachments)?
fields.summary: Encryption for Data at Rest

Sometimes when an image has been attached to a global template, it causes the save functionality not to work.

h2. How to reproduce

The content of the template should get saved

fields.description:
When you open the labels dialog box, either by clicking on the icon or by using the "l" hotkey, the focus remains on the (greyed-out) background and not the input box in the dialog, so when you go to start typing in a label you end up adding attachments or creating new issues, etc.

You have to click on the dialog box before you can type in the label. Since there is literally only this one input box in the dialog, I think it should have the focus by default.
fields.summary: When opening the labels dialog box, please put the focus on the input box

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When loading heavy pages - with several Jira Macros, Attachments and/or Tables - they load a {{Error: Rendering this content exceeded the timeout of 30 seconds.}} message instead of the page's content.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Confluence page
# Add at least 200 Attachments to that page - some tables and Jira Macros, if possible - and make then viewable within the page
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results

The page would load. It would take some time, due to the time of loading all the contents, but it would load as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The page keeps loading for a while, then displays the {{Error: Rendering this content exceeded the timeout of 30 seconds.}} message.

h3. Workaround (Split Content)

# Edit the page by going into edit mode through the URL: {{https://<YOURSITE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACEKEY>/pages/edit/<PageID>}}
# Copy/Cut part of the content
# Create a new page to paste the copied excerpt
# Publish the new page
fields.summary: Error: Rendering this content exceeded the timeout of X seconds.

Confluence wiki always keeps blank space  after a Paragraph. There is no stylesheet without space after a paragraph. I know, that I can replace all returns bei shift-return and I do that, but we are all busy by doing that after copy and pasting text into confluence wiki.

 

Could you please provide a style without space after paragraph or better a possibility to change the styles separately.

 

We use “Festbreitenschriftart”  (fix with font) to paste for example programming code examples but there is a blank line after each code statement

 

With kindly regards

Ulrich Meyer

We've already implemented 'Jira Project Page' extension point in our apps and we like it. Having a similar module for Confluence cloud would be great.

At the moment we can achieve the same by using Custom Content module, but it looks like a hack since we won't actually introduce a new custom content.

After the change of the spacekeys (from ~<username> to ~<random_number>), personal spaces won't appear on the quick search's results.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for a personal space

h3. Expected Results
# All spaces should appear on the search's results.

Only spaces with the old spacekey ~<username> will appear

I would like to propose an option to search for content by users that have been deactivated.

fields.description:
The feature I miss most when creating Confluence pages versus Microsoft Word documents is how easy Word makes navigation (View tab -> Check the "Navigation pane" box, see image below) to different parts of the document when styles / headings are used correctly.  This is very valuable with large documents.

I would like to see a similar panel in Confluence when editing the pages that keys off of the headings within the document, similar to a Table of Contents.

 

!image-2018-07-26-11-50-43-070.png!
fields.summary: Implement a Microsoft Word like Navigation panel when editing pages.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
By default, the [Code Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/code-block-macro-724765175.html] allows the user to select the *Syntax Highlighting* for a specific language so the code will be adapted to it.

However, if the macro is used in the *Comment section* of Confluence, no syntax highlighting will be applied to the same. The code will render as simple text inside the macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any Confluence page, click on the *comment field* in order to add a new comment
# There, from the drop-down menu to select macros (plus icon), click on *other macros* and select the *Code Block* one
# Apply any syntax highlighting and make sure that a code matching with the same will be added
# Publish the comment

h3. Expected Results

The macro should have its syntax highlighting applied to the style. Looking like the following:
!code1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

No syntax highlighting is applied. The code will look like the following:
!code2.png|thumbnail!
 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Code Macro Syntax Highlighting Not Applied for Comments in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers who have the New Editor for Meeting Notes are not having the Parent "Meeting Notes" page created when they create a New Meeting Note in a Brand New Blank Space

h3. Environment
* Cloud  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Confluence Space using the "Blank" Template
# Create and Publish a New Meeting Notes page

h3. Expected Results
2 Pages are Created, the Parent Meeting Notes page (used to group Meeting Notes) and the Dated Meeting Notes page

h3. Actual Results
Only the Dated Meeting Notes page 

h3. Notes
Parent Meetings Notes page is created when using the "Software" Template

h3.Workaround
Manually re-create the Parent Meeting Notes Page; the contents include:
||Macro||Configuration||
|Create from Template|- Template Name: Meeting Notes|
|Task Report Macro|- Space(s) and page(s) - the name of the New Space
- Label(s) - meeting-notes
- Task status - incomplete|
|Content Report Table|- Label(s) - meeting-notes
- Space(s) - the New Space's KEY|

An existing Parent Meeting Notes Page could be copied and moved, however the Macros will need to be updated to reflect the correct Space Information
fields.summary: Meeting Notes Parent Page Not Created in New Space
Remove logging from UserPreRemovalCleanupListener

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The *View Storage format* option is not visible to non space administrators. However, accessing the URL directly does not return any permissions errors and you can access the *Storage format* version without any issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go on a page as a regular non space administrator user.
# Expand the page options menu on the top right.

h3. Expected Results
The *View Storage format* option is displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The *View Storage format* option is displayed and accessing the URL directly does not trigger any errors.

h3.Workaround
To access the page directly, copy the page ID from the URL when viewing the page and use the following format:
{code}
https://<URL>/wiki/plugins/viewstorage/viewpagestorage.action?pageId=<PAGEID>
{code}
fields.summary: 'View Storage format' is not visible to users if they are not space administrators

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When filtering on with *_In Space = current space_*, the Page Property Report macro displays '_*No content found*_'.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud 1000.9xxxx

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in Confluence
# Create child pages, add a label to them (e.g. sprint).
# On the parent page you created, add Page Property Report macro.
# Set to use the label created earlier, and _In Space = Current space_.


h3. Expected Results
Page Properties Report macro Should display all child pages with the label defined in the filter

h3. Actual Results
Shows {{No content found}}
If you were to actually look at the preview in edit mode, it *does* display results.

h3.Workaround
Instead of choosing *current space*, type the name of the current space and select it. The page properties report macro will display properly.
fields.summary: Filtering by Current Space displays no results in Page Property Report Macro

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
Admins are not able to see all their spaces and members that have access to it. If they had this option, this would be very useful to check if all users have the correct access to Spaces.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability, for admins, to see all Spaces and respective users with access to each Space.

h2. Why this is important
To enhance the admin experience, allowing them to have better control over their spaces, and also help them to save a lot of time, seeing all Spaces and members on one page, instead of checking one by one.
fields.summary: Ability to see all Spaces and respective users with access to each Space

fields.description:
*Summary*

In a Confluence page when selecting a word and creating a comment, double "@@" will occur instead of one

*Enviroment*

Confluence Cloud
 Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Google Chrome Версия 62.0.3202.94, (64 бит)
 Ubuntu@16.04, Chrome@65.0.3325.146 64-bit

*Steps to Reproduce*

1. In a Confluence page, select a word

2. Add inline comment

3. Type "@" to 'at mention' someone

Double "@" will occur and the below errors will be thrown in Developer Tools > Console:
{code:java}
 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'mentionResource' of undefined
 {code}
{code:java}
 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'onTextChange' of null
 {code}
*Expected Results*

When @ is pressed, it should return suggestions of members

*Actual Results*

Double '@' will be triggered
 Errors will be thrown in Console 

*Workaround*

Delete the '@' symbols and repeat the steps to mention someone
fields.summary: When creating an inline comment double '@@' will occur

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Having tasks within a table that is wide enough for the mobile app to create a zoom button, when you zoom in the table to check/uncheck the tasks (which is possible) the change (check/uncheck) is not persistent after you zoom out the table to view the full page.
h3. Environment
Confluence Mobile Android app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a table on a page and insert many characters on the header cell to make the table wider
# Insert tasks on the rows below (one task per cell) and save the page
# Open the page on the Confluence Mobile Android app
# You should notice a "plus" sign within a magnifier glass sign on the upper right corner of the table
# Tap this plus-sign-magnifier-glass icon to zoom in the table
# Check/uncheck some tasks
# Go back to zoom out the table and return to the full page

h3. Expected Results
The tasks you checked/unchecked while the table was zoomed in should persist after the table was zoomed out
h3. Actual Results
There was no change in the tasks
fields.summary: Checking/Unchecking tasks on mobile is not persistent after zoom out

	... 25 more	{code}

h3. Notes

It causes the PDF export to stall at 50% with a "Begin conversion of intermediate HTML to PDF" message.

h3. Workaround

You can apply the lines below to your space's PDF Export Stylesheet to remove images. This should allow you to export the text content of your space:

{code}
img {
display: none;
}
{code}
fields.summary: Exports failing due to Media Api

fields.description:
If a link is added in a page pointing to an anchor in another page with page title having *square brackets[]*, the link fails to work. 

h3. How to replicate
# Create a page with the title as *[This Page has Anchor] and more text*
# Add an anchor macro in the page
# Create another page and add a link as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html#InsertLinksandAnchors-Linktoananchoronapage (pagename#anchorname)

h3. Expected behavior
The link should be created. When clicked should take to the mentioned page and anchor.

h3. Actual behavior
The link is not created correctly. Rather it creates a link which created a new draft page.
fields.summary: Link to anchor doesn't work if target page title contains square brackets

fields.description: By default, Jira has time tracking options and add-ons, however, Confluence does not have an option to work with Time Tracking. This is a suggestion to have a bundled macro to allow the user to use it as a Time Tracking.
fields.summary: Time Tracking for Confluence

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Page is rendering inside a section with a scrolling bar instead of the full page when there are external gadgets on the content.
h2. How to reproduce
 # Create a page with enough text or any content that would be bigger in height than the browser window.
 # Add an external gadget to the page.

h3. Expected behaviour

The page would load as expected, the browser's scroll would show up to run down the page.
h3. Actual results

The page loads inside a smaller section to fit the comments section below, this smaller section has a scrolling bar of its own.
h2. Workaround

There is no known workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Page is rendering inside a section with a scrolling bar instead of the full page.

fields.description:
*Summary*

Unable to change text heading for Heading 3 using keyboard shortcut Ctl/Alt/3.


*Steps to replicate*

# Add text in confluence page editor (Test)
# Highlight the text and use the shortcut (Ctl/Alt/3)


*Observed Behaviour*

No changes


*Expected Behaviour*

The text should change to heading 3
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut Ctl/Alt/3 does not work for changing paragraph type to Heading 3

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Page is rendering inside a section with a scrolling bar instead of the full page when there are external gadgets on the content.

  !Screenshot_23.png|thumbnail!
h2. How to reproduce
 # Create a page with enough text or any content that would be bigger in height than the browser window.
 # Add an external gadget to the page.

h3. Expected behaviour

The page would load as expected, the browser's scroll would show up to run down the page.
h3. Actual results

The page loads inside a smaller section to fit the comments section below, this smaller section has a scrolling bar of its own.
h2. Workaround

There is no known workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Very narrow content window

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When choosing profile language from Confluence, blogs option from edit mode does not reflecting on the correct languages.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Set the profile language to *Deutsch* such as  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the blogs in editing mode   !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the page in editing mode  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# The option from the top left corner doesn't reflect on the profile languages.


h3. *Expected Results*

the option should be display as Deutsh

h3. *Actual Results*

the option display as English

h3. *Workaround*
 # None
fields.summary: Blogs Option from Confluence does not reflect on profile language

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

When copy/paste a status macro from blogs, the status macro does not rendered in the destination page.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new blogs (Blog A) and insert a Status macro
# Create a new page B
 # Copy the Status macro from Blog A to Page B
 # Notice that the Status macro does not rendered on the page.


h3. *Expected Results*

Status macro should be copied to a page

h3. *Actual Results*

Status macro doesn't rendered on the page

h3. *Workaround*
 # None
fields.summary: Copy/Paste a status macro does not work in Blogs

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently when editing Confluence pages, there is not possible to view page break in edit mode and thus it causes Confluence as a customer do not have the visibility when the page break will happen when exporting the page to PDF.

There is a similar feature provided by Scoll PDF add-on from https://help.k15t.com/scroll-office/adding-page-breaks-75367932.html. However, it doesn't meet the requirement of having this in edit mode.
fields.summary: Ability to view page break in Edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Taking the example of inline comments inside an *Expand* macro.
If you are mentioned in an inline comment that is placed over some text located inside an *Expand* macro, the link from the *View comment* email notification will indeed open the inline comment thread, but it will not expand the macro therefore not displaying the text on which the comment is placed.

h3. Suggested Solution
 When coming from a link that redirects to the inline comments, it would be great if the *Expand* macro is automatically expanded so we can also see the text where the comment is placed.

h3. Workaround 
Currently, the user is redirected to the macro unexpanded and the inline comment is displayed.
Therefore, it is still required to expand the macro manually and look for the text where the inline comment is placed.
fields.summary: Auto-expand Expand macros when coming from a link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exporting a page as Word in Confluence will result in a threat being flagged by Windows Defender when downloading the file.

h3. Environment
* Windows 10
* Windows Defender updated to the latest version

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a page as Word document.
# Download the file

h3. Expected Results
The file is properly downloaded and nothing goes wrong.

h3. Actual Results
The file is flagged by Windows Defender as a threat:
* https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/wdsi/threats/malware-encyclopedia-description?Name=Trojan:Script/Cloxer.D!cl
 
h3.Workaround
Export your page as PDF for the moment and convert that PDF to Word.
fields.summary: Word exports are flagged as Trojan by Windows Defender

fields.description: I frequently copy and paste text from view mode of confluence into the editor. Sometimes the text in the view mode is slightly different shade of grey than inside editor. It is really annoying to see that the editor keeps the colour and there is no easy way to format it back to default (like it was with CMD+0 in the old editor)
fields.summary: Pasting text in the new editor keeps the source text colour.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The documentation [Change Your Password|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/change-your-password-724765385.html] is outdated, not informing the actual procedure of changing and reseting the password.

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the documentation to reproduce the current procedure.

h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Change Your Password page is not up to date
Test Ticket created by bot

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Google Drive Connector, if you have permission to view or edit a Google Sheet on Google Drive, if you add the Google Drive Connector macro, the sheet gives you a permission error. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Google Sheet
# Create a Page
# Add the Google Drive Connector macro to the page
# Add the link to the created sheet and publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The user is able to see google sheet

h3. Actual Results
It gives you a *You need permission* error. 
 !You need permission.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Google Drive Connector gives a permission error although all permission are correct

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a Saved Jira Filter in the Jira Issue/Filter Macro is not respecting the ORDER BY clause that is saved

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira Create and Save a Filter
# On a Confluence page, add a JIRA Issue/Filter that references the Saved Filter you've created (either "Filter = 'Name of filter'" or "Filter = ID")
# Use the Table display option

h3. Expected Results
Confluence displays a list of issues using the defined order

h3. Actual Results
If the Saved Filter Name or ID is used in the JIRA Issue/Filter, the ORDER BY does not appear to be used; based on testing, it appears that the Issues are sorted by Issue Key and/or Created Date descending.

Here are a few examples with different JQL used
!Example01.png|thumbnail!  

!Example02.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The JQL and Saved Filters display correctly in Jira

h3.Workaround
- Use the JQL for the filter in the Jira Issue/Filter Macro rather than referencing the Saved Filter however this Bug may occur: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-53559

- View the saved filter in Jira
fields.summary: ORDER BY is not Respected in Jira Filter Issue Macro When Using Saved Filter

fields.description:
*Summary*

When trying to publish a page with too many images and text on it, the page will not publish and the content will be lost. This is happening sporadically and is not always reproducible.
h3. Environment

Cloud 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use browser Chrome version 67.0.3396.99
 # Create a page in Confluence
 # Attach lots of images and text on the page
 # Hit Publish
 # Page will not be saved. There are no logs in Drafts

h3. Expected Results

Page to be published
h3. Actual Results

Page will not be saved

*Workaround*
 Perform the same steps again
fields.summary: Unable to publish a page with too many images and text on it

fields.description: I was trying to find a way to un-watch pages/blogs that I had started automatically watching when I edited them and while the rest api documents how to obtain the watches of spaces and specific content items it does not mention how to obtain information on which pieces of content a user is watching. It appears that you can use the [search content by CQL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-search-get] resource to find content items that a user is watching. This is done by specifying  watcher = currentUser() as the cql parameter to the  [search content by CQL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-search-get]  resource (e.g. https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=watcher = currentUser() ).
fields.summary: Mention that user's can find which content items  they are watching using the rest api by using CQL and the search resource

fields.description:
Under the *Space permissions* settings, the *Individual Users* search box does not recognise the user e-mail address.

Right now, you can search by username or full name, username is being deprecated, restricting the user to search for the user full name.

The search box should be able to find a user by searching for his email address.

Example of user.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 12.43.32.png|thumbnail! 

Search for email address, the search box returns *"No matches found"*.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 12.47.28.png|thumbnail! 

Search for name, you will find the user.
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-18 at 12.48.33.png|thumbnail! 

Note: The documentation [Space Permissions Overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/space-permissions-overview-724764760.html] do not specify this information, not being clear if it is a expected behavior or bug, if it is a bug, please update this issue's issuetype to bug.
fields.summary: Space Permissions - Individual Users search box should accept e-mail address.

fields.description:
Summary of the feature:

It would be useful if this feature is implemented for Confluence in passing value from auto numbering row from table.

Exmaple:

Source table has auto number row enabled, when a new row is added to the table. 
2 will be populated as the value for the first column.
||First column || Second Column||
|1. | Example |

It would be useful if this value from the first column could be pass to the destination table dynamically as below: 

Destination table
||First Column|| Second Column||
| Example |     1.  |

Which means that the value from destination table is created dynamically without the need to update the value every time a row is added.
fields.summary: Ability to pass value as an argument from a table

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence doesn't support saving templates with images. However, it's possible to insert an image when creating a template but it won't be saved when you save it. 


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a helpful error when creating a template with an image or better yet prevent insertion of images followed by an error message.
fields.summary: Provide a helpful error when creating a template with an image

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Stride, delete any custom status if you set any
 # Open a browser which has its language setting set to Japanese
 # Access the Confluence Cloud profile
 # Check the status

h3. Expected Results

Correct Japanese translation corresponding to each statuses will appear
h3. Actual Results

The Japanese translations for Available and Busy are very weird.

Please check the problems and suggested translations below:
||Status(English)||Status(Japanese)||Problem||Suggested translation||
|Available|利用可能|This means "anyone can use me". We don't use this term for people.|オンライン|
|Busy|ビジー状態|This is a term used only in the Computer Science area(like network busy).|取り込み中|

!スクリーンショット 2018-07-18 14.06.32.png|thumbnail! !スクリーンショット 2018-07-18 14.09.11.png|thumbnail!

Translation for Away(オフライン) looks natural :)
fields.summary: Weird Japanese translations for status info in Conflluence Cloud profile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Moving pages in Mozilla Firefox and MS Edge browser will get stuck loading.
However, upon refreshing the page, we can see that the page has been moved.

h3. Environment
Mozilla firefox Quantum 61.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In Mozilla Firefox, In MS Edge, In Google Chrome

1. Create a page or go to an existing page
2. Click on ellipses (...)
3. Click on "move"
4. Insert the parent page
5. Click on move

h3. Expected Results
After the load has finished, the page will be refresh and show that the page has been moved successfully.

h3. Actual Results
It loads infinitely

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page after some time.
fields.summary: Move page loads indefinitely

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Keyboard shortcuts for bullet list (Ctrl + Shift + 8) and numbered list (Ctrl + Shift + 7) are not working on Firefox running on Ubuntu.

Issue occurring on both Firefox on Ubuntu VM (hosted on MAC) and Firefox on Ubuntu machine running on non-Mac platforms.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Firefox, *Edit* a Confluence Page
 # Press Ctrl + Shift + 8 OR Ctrl + Shift + 7

h3. Expected Results

Ctrl + Shift + 8 should return bullet list

Ctrl + Shift + 7 should return number list
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is happening

Workaround

Use another browser (Chrome, for example).
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts for bullet list (Ctrl + Shift + 8) and numbered list (Ctrl + Shift + 7) not working on Linux machine running Firefox

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
If you insert the current space's key under the *Space Key* field of the Create from Template macro in Confluence Cloud, the macro warns you that *No Space was Found*, if you then publish the page and edit the macro once again, the macro won't show the templates any longer, so you'll need to remove it, and insert it once again.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a custom template on a space
# Create a new page and insert the Create from Template macro
# Add the current space's key under *Space Key* field
# Select the created template under *Template*
# Publish the page

Now, try to edit the page and the macro again. 

h3. Expected Results
You won't have any issues, you'll be able to edit the macro, and define the current space key without any issues

h3. Actual results
*Space Not Found*  message, as well as the macro getting fuzzy when you try to edit it once again.

h3. Workaround
Remove the macro, insert a new one, and leave the *Space Key* field empty to point to the current space.
fields.summary: Create from Template Macro getting fuzzy when inserting current space's key

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Timezone drop-down doesn't work in Confluence new profile view.
 !profile_timezone.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a Confluence Cloud.
# Access the profile by clicking on avatar at the bottom left corner.
# Click Edit Profile.
# Click on the drop-down arrow for *Time zone* setting.

h3. Expected result
There will be drop-down menu for available options.

h3. Current result
Clicking the arrow does nothing. A user will need to click near the region/city in order to change the time zone.
fields.summary: Timezone dropdown doesn't work in Confluence new profile view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence server, a macro parameter (full_attachment) can be used to store an attachment's storage format which plays nicely when exporting/importing spaces, renaming attachments, and renaming pages containing the attachments.

This is currently a gap in Confluence cloud's API as there is no cloud counterpart for it. 

h3. Expected Results
A macro parameter for cloud that can handle changes to the attachments being referenced.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Store absolute references to attachments as macro parameter

fields.description:
The context menu for Bar edit is not accessible (behind the context and is greyed out) hence I can't delete or edit bars already added. I can add new bars however.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Firefox
* Chrome
fields.summary: Can't edit Roadmap planner macro anymore

fields.description:
This is a suggestion to add the functionality to display the child pages of a Space Shortcut on the sidebar. 

Currently, you can only insert a single page, while in some scenarios it would be nice to have a way to display those child pages as well.
fields.summary: Add a way to view Child Pages under a Space Shortcut

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

HTML formatted text such as <div> break Confluence formatting

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a new page
 # Copy and paste content from a rich editor such Goolge docs and Microsolf office
 # Noticed that the line spacing in Confluence doesn't work well

h3. *Expected Results*

Confluence should be able to adapt to HTML content from other source

h3. *Actual Results*

HTML formatted content break Confluence formatting
h3. *Notes*

This was an known issue when content was copied from a better editor


h3. *Workaround*
 # Copy the content and paste it to "Notepad" which doesn't support HTML formatting and paste it back on Confluence to remove the HTML content such as <div> tags
fields.summary: HTML formatted text does not work in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Team Calendar uses the *user.timezone* value in Confluence when sending information to external applications.
Therefore, Outlook throws errors when importing tasks from Team Calendar if the timezone set in Outlook is different than UTC.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Microsoft Outlook
* Team Calendars on Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to a Calendar from Outlook 2010
# Make sure your local machine timezone is not set to UTC as well as your Outlook server timezone.
# Sync the calendar

h3. Expected Results
No errors and the events are properly synced.

h3. Actual Results
Events are properly synced but an error message is displayed in Outlook about a mismatch in Timezone as Outlook is unable to recognize the TZID (for example 'Europe/London') sent from Team Calendars.
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: When subscribing to a Calendar from Outlook, Outlook throws timezone errors because of Confluence user.timezone value

fields.description:
Word file import containing XML code is not working properly

h3. Summary
If a Word file has a specific XML code, any content after the xml code will not be imported. Word import will not give an error. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Word file with 10 pages
# On Page 5 of the Word file, insert the below content 
{code}
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<config>
    <releases>
        <stale_limit>3</stale_limit> <!--Number of hours to pass until a release is considered stale and will not be processed anymore-->
        <tries_limit>3</tries_limit> <!--Number of times a release is processed until giving up-->
    </releases>

    <!A list of replicas where to any change made on this env will be propagated>
    <sync_envs>
        <!--<replica>replica1</replica>--> <!--example-->
    </sync_envs>
</config>
{code}
# Save the Word file.
# Import the Word file to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
- The whole content of the Word file will be imported

h3. Actual Results
- The Word import will only import the content before the XML code, any content after the XML code will not be imported. 

h3. Workaround
- Remove the XML content on the Word file.
fields.summary: Word file containing XML code will not be imported properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking a video attachment inside a dynamic macro does not play the video file. Video plays when not inside a dynamic macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Drag and drop a movie into a page during editing 
# Save page
# Click on the video file

h3. Expected Results
Movie file will be played just like when the video file is not inside a dynamic macro.

h3. Actual Results
The video file is downloaded.
fields.summary: Video file preview of a view-file macro does not work inside dynamic macros

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are seeing Deactivated Administrator accounts within the Space Settings > Space Details apge

 !image-2018-07-13-17-36-32-602.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Hide inactive accounts

h3. Why this is important
If an Admin is no longer active, they should not be visible in the Space Details; we should only see Active accounts
 
h3. Workaround 
Remove Confluence Application Access from the Deactivated Account
fields.summary: Hide Deactivated Admins from Space Details

fields.description:
In Confluence Cloud, when the user is scrolling up a page, a pop up with the page operations/breadcrumbs will be displayed so the same can quickly access it. In some cases, this could interrupt on how the user is reading and accessing the content. 

This is a suggestion to give the user the ability to disable/enable the pop up to be displayed in the editor.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable Top of Page Popup When Scrolling Up

It would be great that *external users*, when accessing [https://<yourinstance>.atlassian.net/wiki/browsepeople.action|https://missionbio.atlassian.net/wiki/browsepeople.action], could be able to search other external users with access to the same spaces they are allowed in. 

At the moment, when the People Directory is hidden for external users, accessing the link does not allow these users to search for other external users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes, for some kind of PDF or word files, the file viewer will keep loading the current page forever.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert a PDF/ DOCX/ XLSX file;
# Insert a PDF/ word / excel macro
# Publish and reload the page.

h3. Expected Results
The file should render normally;

h3. Actual Results
After scrolling, an infinite spinner is shown on the file and the current document's page is shown blank.
It may need to reload the page a couple of times to notice the issue.  
 
h3. Notes
* I was able to reproduce this with files created with google docs, then opened with Word and exported to PDF.
* Thousands of the following +information+ are shown on the console (select to show info or any logs):
{code}mediaviewer-2.js:1531 Deprecated API usage: page destroy method, use cleanup() instead{code}

h3.Workaround
Reloading the page will sometimes render the file correctly.
fields.summary: File viewer keeps loading the file intermitently

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Have a behavior similar to Jira Cloud's [Get user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-user-get] wherein _timezone_ is returned.

We need this in order to display dates in the correct format for each user, to avoid
 # much confusion regarding when events occurred
 # everyone has to work in UTC

h3. Note
For consistency purposes, it can also be added in Confluence's [Get current user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-user-current-get] and/or in [Get user|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-user-get]
fields.summary: Return user's timezone via REST API

fields.description:
In Confluence, there are no drop-down macros for the user so the same can use it for form purposes or fill tables with specific information, so the same will not be needed to be manually inserted into the table's cell. 

A quick example of use case is when you have a table with a particular value that can be tied to different options (companies, for example) in which the user could quickly change it according to the macro configuration options. 

This is a suggestion to create a Drop Down List macro for Confluence.
fields.summary: Drop-down List Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's currently not possible to use the feed generated with Confluence's Feed Builder

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the [Feed Builder|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/the-rss-feed-builder-724765362.html]
# Create the feed
# Try to use it on any feed reader

h3. Expected Results
The reader should read the feed

h3. Actual Results
The feed is not recognized by the reader;
 
h3. Notes
Even when using the solution suggested [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/basic-authentication/], the response is an 403 status:
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-12 at 15.45.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There's currently no workaround.
fields.summary: It's currently not possible to use the RSS Feed created with Confluence

fields.description: The code blocks in Questions for Confluence doesn't look very good. There is always a horizontal scrollbar which could be hidden if not needed. The code blocks could also be better visually separated from regular text, for example with a slightly gray background. Would it be possible to improve this area?
fields.summary: Code blocks in Questions for Confluence could be improved

fields.description:
Users cannot login to Confluence Cloud mobile application, when we open the Confluence Cloud mobile app, it kicked us out, try to log in again and it says:

“We couldn’t log you in. Wait a moment and try again."

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Users are not able to log into Confluence iOS mobile app

fields.description:
h3.The Issue
When trying to edit text on Confluence Cloud, the heading editor is not working.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Access your instance
# Go to a page
# Ensure that the URL follows this syntax: https://<yourinstance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/blog/edit-v2/{contentID}
# Select a text and try to use the Headings drop down to edit the text format

h3. Expected Results
The editor would change the selected text to the selected heading
h3. Actual Results
The Editor does not change the text.
fields.summary: Headings are not working on the editor v2

fields.description:
When impersonating an user, the UI informs that you're logged in as another User in a pop-up. The problem is that while you're working/testing as the user the pop-up goes away, making difficult to switch back to your account.

 

It would be great to have this information and the option to switch back to your account on a fixed banner at the top of the page.

!image-2018-07-12-10-25-52-528.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Inform the users that they are impersonating another user and provide the ability to switch back to their accounts on a fixed banner instead of a pop-up

fields.description: Obtaining the contents / stored  body content of a page is clearly indicated by the various [get content|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-get] apis. While the `body.storage` is mentioned under the [Update content api|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-content-id-put] information it should also be mentioned and or included in the get content apis.
fields.summary: The expand information for the "Get content" rest resource should include "body.storage"
